title: How to get Hulu on my smart TV - Quora

response.answer_text: Smart TV operating systems are able to connect to the internet via WiFi or ethernet cable to access online content like the Hulu app. If you own a smart TV, you don’t need any other accessory to help you watch your favorite show on Hulu. Some smart TVs will come with inbuilt applications like Netflix, Hulu, and others. If your TV set doesn’t have a Hulu app, simply download the app to stream online. Here’s how to get Hulu to work on your smart TV: Press “Home” button on your remote to go to the hubSelect Apps and search “Hulu” on the search box at the upper-right cornerFollow on-screen prompts and install the Hulu appLaunch the appSelect the “log in” and specify log in on this deviceEnter your credentials and press “Log in”Choose your preferred profile and start streamingIf you previously created your Hulu subscription using Apple TV, then you’ll have to change a few tweaks and go to complete account setup before logging in to Hulu with your smart TV. I recommend you to try XOOMTV on your smart TV. This app has more shows from different streaming providers and it’ll be cheaper for you to watch everything there.

The best way to get Hulu for your smart TV is usually to download the app from it. A lot of smart TV’s will have some type of app store where you can download it. Do be aware that sometimes Hulu stops updating their app on the appstore which has happened to me personally where I could no longer play it because Hulu stopped updating their app. You can always play it on your laptop and then connect laptop with HDMI cable to your TV. Like Richard also mentioned you can use an Amazon firestick and download the Hulu app so you can watch it on your Smart TV
